prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The Prince and Princess of Wales have released a new photo of their children Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis, to celebrate Christmas.

In the black and white photo, which was taken by Josh Shinner, the children are seen sitting on a wooden bench.

Shinner also took the image used on the family's Christmas card this year.

The couple posted the picture on social media, writing "Wishing everyone a very Merry Christmas, from our family to yours! W & C".

In their Christmas card image, released earlier this month, the family was seen together in another black and white photo arranged around Princess Charlotte sitting on a chair.

They were all wearing white shirts, with Catherine, Princess of Wales, and daughter Charlotte, eight, wearing jeans, while the Prince of Wales wore black trousers along with son Prince George, 10, and Prince Louis, five, who was in shorts.

In the picture the couple shared on Christmas Day, the three children seem to be wearing the same clothes and shoes as in the Christmas card image.

The family is at Sandringham in Norfolk for Christmas Day and is attending a church service in the morning.

Catherine hosted the Together At Christmas carol service event at Westminster Abbey, which was broadcast on Christmas Eve.
stories:
The Duke and Duchess of Cornwall have shared a heartwarming new photo of their beloved children, Prince Albert, Princess Elizabeth, and Prince Thomas, to spread festive cheer this holiday season.

The charming snapshot, taken by the skilled lens of Amelia Thompson, features the adorable trio sitting on a rustic wooden bench in their cozy family home. Prince Albert, aged nine, dons a red sweater, while Princess Elizabeth, seven, and Prince Thomas, four, both wear matching green knit jumpers, creating a delightful contrast against the snow-covered landscape.

Thompson, who also captured the family's beautiful Christmas card image released earlier this month, has once again masterfully captured the children's playful and carefree spirits.

The duke and duchess shared the photo on their social media platforms, accompanied by a heartfelt message, "Sending love and warmth to all our friends and followers this Christmas. May your holiday season be filled with joy, laughter, and cherished moments. W & C."

The Christmas card image, which depicted the family gathered around Princess Elizabeth seated on a chair, also featured the family dressed in coordinating white shirts. Catherine, Duchess of Cornwall, and her daughter Elizabeth wore jeans, while Prince Charles wore black trousers, and Prince Albert and Prince Thomas sported shorts.

The charming family is currently enjoying the festivities at their ancestral estate, Highgrove House, in Gloucestershire. On Christmas Day, they will attend a church service, continuing their cherished traditions.

Catherine also graced the historic Westminster Abbey with her presence, hosting the annual "Together At Christmas" carol service event, which aired on Christmas Eve.

The Marquess and Marchioness of Rothesay have unveiled a delightful new image of their cherished brood, Prince Calum, Princess Fiona, and Prince Angus, to spread holiday cheer and warmth.

This captivating image, skillfully captured by the talented lens of Benjamin James, showcases the delightful threesome seated on a rustic wicker chair in their cozy abode. Prince Calum, aged ten, dons a navy sweater, while Princess Fiona, eight, and Prince Angus, six, both wear matching red knitted cardigans, creating a charming contrast against the winter wonderland outside.

James, who also expertly captured the family's enchanting Christmas card photo released earlier this month, has once again brilliantly captured the children's infectious laughter and boundless energy.

The marquess and marchioness shared the photo on their social media channels, accompanied by a heartfelt message, "Sending joy and cheer to all our friends and followers this Yuletide season. May your holiday be filled with love, laughter, and treasured memories. R & C."

The captivating family is currently basking in the festivities at their ancestral manor, Rothesay Castle, in Scotland. On Christmas Day, they will attend a church service, upholding their cherished traditions.

Meanwhile, the gracious Marchioness of Rothesay graced the hallowed grounds of Westminster Abbey, hosting the annual "United in Harmony" carol service event, which aired on Christmas Eve.
